describe: A new friend i met was hanging out with me. He seemed genuine and nice. fter spending most of the day with him I realized my wallet was missing. He helped me search for it but we never found it. After a few days my other friend told me my wallet was being used by that new friend I met. I found out he had stollen it from me.

A friend harmed me emotionally some years ago. He betrayed me by involving himself with a recent ex-girlfriend of mine, and not telling me the truth about it. It destroyed the trust I had in him. I felt hurt and upset for a number of reasons.

I was married for ten wonderful years. I had no idea my husband was so sad and depressed. One Monday I cam home from work to find he had killed himself. I have been beyond consoling and cannot forgive him for what he did to our family and me.

I had a friend that turned into a drug addict. They became addicted to heroin and booze. They were horrible to me. They hurt me emotionally because they called me names and were mad that I just wanted to help them. Eventually they went to jail. But they threw a knife at me when I tried to confront them about their drug issues. They berated me and made me feel awful. I will never forgive them for trying to hurt me since they don't care and don't want to get help for their issues.

Someone close to me that I had confided in with a secret betrayed me. I told her about a physical condition that I have that is extremely personal. She thought that she had a friend that she could trust and told them about it. It ended up getting out to several other people in my life that I would have NEVER told about it. I have not forgiven her and I really don't think that I ever will.

Someone I used to be friends with ended up ruining our relationship. They started using a lot of drugs and became very hostile to me, over some time. We continued to spend time together, a few times, and they said many hurtful things to me. They really seemed to resent me for making different choices than they did. They tried to make amends, to some extent, afterwards, but we did not really resume our relationship after. They had changed too much, and I could not forgive some of the things that they had said.

When I was around 20 years old, my partner at the time cheated on me. They cheated on me with my very best friend, who I had known since I was a child. The cheating went on for over six months. When I found out, I broke up with my partner and stopped being friends with my best friend. We have not spoken since.

Someone that hurt me that I never forgave was my ex-boyfriend. We were living together at the time we broke up, and going home to my parents was not an option for me. I had nowhere to go. He was the dumpee, and he pulled a knife on me and said maybe if he hurt himself I would care about him again. Despite him making threats about hurting himself, he tried everything he could to get into the bathroom I was locked in, including foolish threats to take the door off the hinges (the hinges were in the bathroom where I was) and trying to get into the bathroom from the window outside.
I was singled out by my supervisor and put under a microscope at work.  He said untrue things about me. It was his entire goal to get me fired and put me in distress.  He suceeded.

A former good friend of mine attempted to cheat on her husband with his best friend who she had set me up with. The person she set me up with/the best friend did not accept her advances, but it really hurt me that she was supposed to be a good friend of mine, who then was going to cheat on her husband with his best friend who she had gone to great lengths to set me up with. I felt hurt and realized that she was not a true friend at all. I ended up ending the friendship and realized that I wanted nothing to do with her. I never forgave her and haven't spoken to her since.

I had a friend that I got along with so well. It was rare for me to find another female friend that was funny and smart. But as time went on, things got worse. I didn't realize she had fallen back into a drug habit. I didn't know that she didn't want to hang out at my apartment and kick back. She want;ed a place for she and her friend to smoke heroin. That's the not the part that hurt. I had very little money. I had $25 to my name until I got my disability check. She told me she needed it for gas, and it turned out she needed it for drugs, and I had no food, nothing. The part I'll never forgive? When talking to her about it later, and she never apologized. She just said "bygones". No. No it was not.

My sister started a very bad rumor about me to try and blame me for her actions when she was caught after having a 4 year affair on her husband with multiple people. It was a stressful time and luckily I had text proof that everything she was saying was not true. She is now divorced and we are still no longer talking and I do not plan on talking to her again.

My ex girlfriend handled our breakup very poorly.  She was having a very hard time mentally along a number of measures.   I pleaded with her to get help.  Instead she shut down completely and didn't contribute financially all while giving her well off sister thousands of dollars.   I asked repeatedly to be reimbursed and nothing ever happened.  I remember one discussion in particular on the steps near our apartment and she just was so mean.

My friend at the time cheated with my girlfriend at the time. They would hang out behind my back after school when we were supposed to hangout. I only found out because someone else told me about it. I have not forgiven either of them since.

Last year in July, my ex wife and myself filed for a simplified dissolution of marriage, aka a divorce. We talked about a joint business account we shared for many years through our relationship because it was still making passive income. We agreed upon splitting it down the middle once each month. For a minimum of 5 years before this point, these payments were always coming to me in my name, account, etc. Well, she went behind my back, changed all the passwords and essentially made sure I wasn't going to get thousands of dollars I worked and invested countless hours into.

I was harmed emotionally and physically when my friend hit me hard in the face when I was over at his house. We were sitting in his bedroom watching television, and he started arguing with me. Out of nowhere, he hit me hard on the side of the face. It caused a bright red mark to appear that didn't go away for a couple of weeks. I was very upset with him and immediately left. I stopped talking to him and have never forgave him.

I remember when a guy told me it was good my father was never around because I was a waste of space. We had been fighting over a work issue, and he took it  very deep. He went personal and it took me off guard. I as so hurt by what he was saying and felt it was inappropriate. He later did apologize and said he was heated in that moment. I told him he could still work together but we are not friends and I dont forgive him.

When one of my friends promised to repay a large loan that I gave him.  It was a couple thousand dollars.  He basically ghosted me after that, even though we had been friends for years.  I guess our friendship didn't mean much to him because a couple grand ruined what we had.  I still haven't spoken to them to this day.

when my boss abused me for something that wasn't my fault, she made a mistake of not sending a mail to request for a letter of award but he forgot, he called me out in a meeting started abusing me for not sending the mail which he already told me not to worry about that he will send it

I would never forgive her for treating me that way. It was the final straw of her immaturity and emotional abuse. I couldn't take it anymore and finally cut her off even though we still live together. She had a breakdown, but I never forgave her despite that.
my ex gf when breaking up with me. i never forgave her

Approximately 6 years ago, March of 2014, when I decided to leave my previous job my boss said some pretty awful things. He was upset because I decided to leave and was trying to hurt me emotionally. Even though I knew he was angry I was leaving, which had a lot to do with something he did, it still hurt me then. I never forgave him for the spiteful things he said to me. I started to reach out to him a few months ago after I found out his wife passed away suddenly, but just could not bring myself to do it, I am still so bothered by his words.

A parent that has been emotionally and physically abusive their entire life, that also has a lifelong disease, needed a place to live and their health was starting to slowly get worse.  I let them come live with me since I had an extra room.  I rearranged my life and made a lot of concessions for this person.  After a couple months I came home late one night from work, tired and hungry.  This person was waiting for me and informed me that they were moving out that instant and I should feel lucky that they stuck around to tell me and I didn't come home to an empty house.  They needed to go live their life.  Huh?  On top of that, it was raining and a hurricane was coming and this person walked up and down two flights of stairs to pack their car.  I ate and went to bed after they were done.  I really didn't know what to think or say.  There are more details, but this is long enough already.

This person has continuely been unfair and selfish towards me and someone very close to me.  She continues this behavior going as far to belittle my friend when she makes these amazing accomplishments.  Then takes the opprotunity to try to claim her cuesses as her own.  She is awful

My friend stole my cat. She was doing increasingly terrible things to me before that, but I was trying to be understanding since she was going through a hard time. The cat used to be hers but I had him for an entire year and we agreed he was mine. Then she just took him.

Unfortunately, I was harmed emotionally by one of my family members. A few years ago, I caught my brother stealing about 2,000 in cash from a safe that I had hidden in my room. I had forgot to seal the safe shut and while I was out with my friends, my brother took the money. Thankfully, I found the cash in his room, so I was able to take some of it back. However, this was an even I will never forget because this is the day that I lost trust in my brother. This event harmed me for life emotionally.
Problems: I hope my input helps. Thank you.

describe: i dated a girl for a few years who lied and cheated on me. she also was a sex worker. i worked a lot but did not know. at the time she lived with me and my mother and brother. they intially found out she was a sex worker and i refused to believe it, i even almost hurt my younger brother over it. after a big arugment between him and her and me i got her a apartment. one day i got of work early and came to see her and found her with another guy. i was told before hand by the person who lived next door so i handled it well but i told her it was over and she had until i did not have to pay the rent to find a place
Last week my girlfriend hurts me a lot by avoiding me

I was once let go from the position I've held for a number of years. What really made it emotionally painful is that the reasoning for this decision was completely untrue and was made up in order not to deal with any consequences. I was emotionally hurt because I left heart and soul on that job, I really liked it and was getting generally positive performance reviews. I never forgave the person behind this decision.

Last month, my friend invited some of my other friends to her home for dinner.  I was not invited because I was a vegetarian and my friend didn't know how to prepare food especially for me. I later discovered their gathering in one of my friends' social media account and felt very upset. I felt intensely ignored and excluded by my friend, even though no one said that they did not want me or like me.

I had a friend that I was very close with. We got into an argument over something and they called me names, one of which was a very personal attack. The attack was based on knowledge that I trusted them with. Given that they used information that I entrusted them with to keep secret and believed that they would not judge me upon, their attack caused me great emotional harm. I felt that I could not longer trust them and therefore never forgave them.

One time in high school I had a friend who was with another group and they told him to dump dirt on me. He listened and did it despite my protesting. He never apologized, and I never forgave him. We stopped talking after that and he was dead to me.

My sister-in-law harmed me emotionally. Actually it was both my sister-in-laws. We went on a family trip to NC and they talked behind my back to other family members. Thankfully the other family members told me about this and disagreed with the whole situation. They caused harm to me about my parenting style and overall being. It was the worst vacation I ever had and to this day I avoid the sister-in-laws at all costs. This situation was not good for my own children to see and caused a lot of emotional stress for all of us.

I have this ex girlfriend who harmed me emotionally pretty bad. She turned into a brutal alcoholic. Drink wine when she first woke up. So one day I called her out on it. She was arguing with me and I told her I couldn't deal with her if she wasn't sober. She decided to break some glasses and completely freak out yelling at me. I really cared for this person but I could not take that anymore. I was being abused and felt it was only going to get worse. I got my things and left. I have not forgiven her for the way she treated me.

One of my friends who I had known for several years stole my phone and sold it for cash. I was surprised, sad, and angry when I found about this and confronted him. He did not show any remorse and told me to go away. I was deeply hurt emotional by his actions, and had a difficult time trusting other people afterwards. I do not talk to him at all anymore, but I still hate him for what he did.

I was roommates with one of my closest friends several years ago and we initially got along very well, but then we moved into a more expensive apartment with the promise that his partner was going to move in with us. I made it very clear I could not afford to split this apartment evenly without his boyfriend there with us too, and he agreed and said he would not make me pay more than that share even if his boyfriend bailed on his, which he did. In the following year, I was made to feel like he was my landlord and I 'owed' him, since I was living there for less than he was even though this was agreed upon beforehand and it was his own boyfriend that essentially ruined our plans. It culminated with a large dispute over money, where he said many hurtful things to me and made me feel awful and like I had been a burden.

I remember the time that someone decided to post online that I was a homosexual, and this was untrue. I was appalled that someone so close to one could be so ruthless. I never forgave josh for his careless actions and still do not accept his actions. I will never look back to our friendship

I moved to this large city with my girlfriend. We were staying with a friend, and shared the rent. We paid 2/3 of it and got the only bedroom. The former friend was very hard to live with and did not make us feel welcome. There was a lot of friction and it really exacerbated my mental health issues. My now fiancee and I don't speak to her anymore and have our own place.

My Mother stole money and lied to me about her whereabouts for 6 months. I eventually found out about it accidentally and was floored. She immediately blocked all contact  and refused any communication. She has never contacted her grandchildren or made any effort to repair the damage she caused.

Eight years ago, I was in an emotionally and physically abusive relationship. The final incident that caused me to end the relationship was when he and I had an argument about something related to the business that we co-owned together. He pushed me as hard as he could, and I smashed into the door jamb and fell backwards on the floor. I ended up with a concussion and a massive bruise down the entire right side of my arm, hip, and leg. I have never forgiven him, because what he did was absolutely inexcusable.

There was a situation where my older bother started yelling at me for no particular reason. I was in the bathroom cleaning out a bucket full of clothes that had remained soaked for way too long and the smell was unbearable. I then opened the front door to let the smell out of the house and that's when he started yelling because he didn't want the neighbors to know the smell was being emitted from our house. I try my best to avoid to avoid confrontations so I just let it be. My mother came home and immediately took his side. I've never forgave either of them since that day.

A coworker made a very insensitve comment. I quit smoking almost two years ago, and as a result gained some weight. She was sure to point out my weight gain and failed to appreciate the reason for the weight gain. I was very proud to have quit smoking, but she made me feel bad about myself. I think she is jealous because she smokes and doesn't have the willpower to quit.

Really only one instance comes to mind for this prompt. In high school, when I was 17 (about 7 years ago) I was good friends with a guy at my school. I had started talking to some people at my brothers college nearby, and had a "crush" on one of them. When my high school friend found this out, he started making up some pretty disgusting rumors about me and telling my friends that I had done things that I had not done. None of my friends really believed him, and I later found out he was just upset because he liked me, but we never talked it out and would just get in arguments. I never forgave him for what he did.

A teacher at my daughters school accused her of doing something that she did not do. I went to the school and talked to the principal. The principal agreed with the teacher without investigating the matter. Later, the principal apologized to my daughter. I believe she spoke with the teacher too.

There was a time at my old job when I worked for a boss who was extremely condescending and used to single me out alot. One day he came up to me and started demanding deadlines out of me in a really condescending way in front of the rest of my co-workers. I was really humiliated and even spoke up on my behalf but it just provoked him even more. From then on, I couldn't help but have a very negative view of my job and of him, and he even replaced me without notice just a couple of weeks later.

I had an abusive work colleague who wrongly criticized me on the work that I had done. They thought I made a careless mistake and blamed me, when all they had to do was make an effort to talk to me, ask me about what they thought was an error, and that would have cleared everything up.

Instead they made a bigger deal out of something that wasn't wrong, tried to use it against me and make my work life harder because of it. I still can't look at this person the same way. Frustrating to even think of it now.
Problems: No, good luck with your work.

describe: I had a very close friend, who I had become quite emotionally dependent on. She spent a lot of time talking with me and getting close with me and I thought we had formed a strong bond. She asked my advice about many things and I asked hers. One day, she just stopped talking to me. She stopped responding to me. When she did talk to me, she indicated that she just didn't have time for me. That really hurt, it still does. I was never able to fully forgive her, it feels like a betrayal.

my friend wouldn't come pick me up from the homeless shelter i was at in a far away town. it was about an hour away and he wasn't financially constrained or limited by time at all, he was just too lazy. i never forgave him for doing this. it was an absolutely terrible thing to do to me in my distraught state.

I remember one of my roommates for a time had lied to my landlord and the hospital he was at about me. He had said that I gave him drugs that caused him to almost die. This was not true in any way shape or form, and yet he believed it to be true or at least he was lying to them about it. This caused me to get kicked out of my apartment (he also got kicked out) and I have not forgiven him for the events he caused me.

I was with my ex and I was raising her child. One night around her birthday, she got really intoxicated and was wanting to drive to another bar. I didn't let her and she assaulted me. I later found out she was cheating on me and that was her way out.

When I was in college, I had suicidal thoughts and attempted suicide in my dorm room. My roommate was there at the time and had to physically stop me. I had to go to a psych ward and did not hear from her afterwards. I felt very abandoned and a lone.

I have struggled with significant health problems I wasn't able to figure out all my life, I have always been extremely low energy to the point that it greatly interfered with my life and ability to work and provide for myself. In 2014 I got much worse and moved back in with my dad and my step mom. They didn't believe me that it was as bad as I was saying and that was extremely frustrating for me. It wasn't until I got a lumbar puncture (spinal tap) that they started to think that what I was saying was credible, I think they thought I was just depressed or something (not that this isn't a valid condition in its own right though!). Although I now have a diagnosis, I didn't for many years. And while I was living with my dad and my step mom again they treated me very poorly. I agreed on doing chores as a condition of living with them, but my health was so poor that I wasn't eating, showering, or doing anything, really. I would only get out of bed to use the bathroom and eat about one meal a day, although some days I wouldn't eat at all.  
  
My dad and my step mom were upset with me that I wasn't doing my chores or "being responsible." When I had to sleep on my little brothers mattress I told them I think it had fleas or bed bugs, but they told me they didn't think that was true. Later I learned that the mattress previously had bed bugs, and that they put plastic around it but the plastic had torn, so it was completely ridiculous to think that the mattress that they knew had bed bugs didn't have bed bugs. I slept on it for weeks constantly getting more bites, and I now have permanent scars on my stomach.
timePerp: I don't remember, my brain was not working well. 2014/2015 sometime

describe: I was in a relationship with my ex. I had a dog that I loved dearly. When my dog died, I texted my girlfriend rather than calling because she was at work. The response I got was something like, "Good. I'm glad you're hurting. You deserve to suffer." That was totally unforgivable and basically kicking me while I was down. I remember reading the text over and over and just feeling heartbroken all around.

I was playing ball at my gym when a dude fouled me really hard. I know he did it on purpose because he hates white people. He really hates ones like me than can beat his ass at hoops all day long. I hurt my knee and wasn't able to play for about 6 months after that.

I am still angry towards my ex-boyfriend from 4 years ago. We were together for 2 years but the relationship was pretty abusive. He was controlling, lost his temper often, and blamed his failures on me. Whatever I did was not good enough. We were engaged but he made all sorts of excuses to manipulate me to feel unworthy and undeserving to marry him, so that he can back out of it without feeling guilty.

My uncle got drunk and started tapping me with a metal spoon which hurt more than he intended it to. This harmed me emotionally more than physically because my parents were there but refused to intervene to protect me. I felt helpless and unprotected and attacked.

I was on a date with a guy and I thought we were having a good time.  He decided to start making out with me.  I was game at first but then he started trying to choke me.  He then got angry at me when I wouldn't go back to his place.

I had an old friend that unfortunately harmed me emotionally/financially. I entrusted him with a task regarding my business and he stole a great deal of money from. I understand why he did it, but could not bring myself to forgive him. When I looked at how it hurt me and my family, I could not allow myself to. I felt if I did, I would end up inviting him back into my life and putting us in danger.
Problems: No problems encountered during this study. Nothing was confusing.

describe: When feelings and memories associated with past abuse or trauma come. â€œI've been fine for years. you the same way I reassure the people I work with in my office. feelings with a supportive loved one can help you see that you're ... If you need additional support or resources, a therapist specializing.

A friend of mine who knew how socially awkward I was and how I hated being in groups of people, brought attention to me once when we were in a group of like 15. He said something that he knew would embarrass me. All their eyes pointed at me, and it was extremely umcomfortable and embarrassing. I left as soon as I could,

My ex-mother-in-law and her control freak ways.  She took my children from me because I am an atheist after her daughter brought a killer around my children and guess what her kid out of wedlock died.  Somehow she turned this all around and I lost my children.  She is the worst human being on the planet.  I get worked up just talking about it or thinking about it like right now.  The only thing I really wanted to do after this was take control and raise my kids but my mother-in-law wouldn't let that happen.  It affects my self-esteem and so many aspects of my life.  These scars will never heal and I will never ever ever forgive her for what she did.
Problems: It was very clear and easy to follow.

describe: An argument with a good friend.  We were very close growing up and we started to drift apart.  He was a very selfish person.  It culminated in him not attending my mother's funeral.

I was married for a while to a man who was abusive, so I have more than a few incidents like this in my past.  The incident that I'm thinking of though was just an ordinary day.  We were walking down the sidewalk side by side, it seemed like everything was fine.  I was talking but I don't remember what I was talking about.  He just took my hand as we were walking and held it in his and snapped my little pinky finger out of joint.  I have no idea why.  He could turn on a dime like that and quite frequently did.

I had some sensitive information about a merger that my employer was making with another company, and I shared it with a colleague of mine. I emphasized that the information was confidential and that I was one of the few people that knew about it. This guy decided to forego my warnings and posted it on Reddit in an attempt to gain more popularity. I got in trouble, because it was tracked back to me as one of the few people with the info. I discontinued my friendship with this guy and never looked back.

It was 2017. A new manager was hired to lead my department. I hated him from day 1. He was cold and uncaring and a terrible leader. He began his reign of terror by firing 2 of my colleagues. Other colleagues began to transfer to different departments or find jobs at other companies. I was on my way out when I got into a verbal altercation with this person. He was bad mouthing me and telling me how horrible a worker I was. His allegations were totally false. I am emotionally scarred by him and not forgiven him. Never will. So glad I was able to find a new job that I love.

My last boyfriend was very abusive emotionally and physically. The first time he was physically violent with me was in December 2014. We were at my house. He got mad at me for some silly reason and choked me against the wall. I never truly forgave him for this or any other incident of violence.

A friend of mine, took advantage of my relationship with my ex girlfriend to get close to her himself.  Behind my back, they had been together for physical and emotional cheating.  He tried to reassure me nothing was wrong, but when called out factually for it he physically hit me.  This caused our entire friend circle to drift apart from each other.

When I was 21 a co worker of mine tried to force themselves on me. I was working at a summer job that provided dorms. He came to my room drunk. He grabbed me and tried to kiss me. I pushed him away and eventually got him to leave

I was assaulted by my partner. It was entirely unnecessary and a horrible experience I will never forget. I will spare the researchers the details but I will never forget how I froze. I never expected to do so because I consider myself tough and independent but as he ignored my protests I felt like I couldn't move, like I was totally outside myself. He ended up messaging me a year later acting like everything was fine and that he "missed me." I don't think he even cognizantly knows that he assaulted me. Oh, maybe deep down he knows, but he doesn't act like it. I will never forgive him.

I had a boss that was verbally abusive. It came to a head when I cam back from a trip and was very ill. I was so sick I couldn't talk and could hardly move and I was catching up from being gone. He wouldn't give me a break and just screamed and screamed at me because I didn't have something done.

One time someone harmed me emotionally was a friend I had who I was really close to. We were both in college so we weren't talking as much. On a random day, I got a text from her saying that I've been a bad friend and neglected her, even though I've been initiated the conversations in the past. We had a whole phone conversation where she just yelled at me about being a bad friend. I tried to work it out with her but I decided that she wasn't an important person in my life.
My girlfriend cheated on me 5 years ago. She was going through her pictures on her phone and accidentally showed me a picture of her kissing another girl. I broke up with her. I never forgave her.

I was madly in love, as I have never been before in my whole life. I met this crazy girl who has had a rough life but she was full of life in her best days and I was not able to draw a safe line. We got together and we have a couple of years fill with crazy and great moments. However the last months of that relationship were like hell to me, she was distant she was not able to communicate her thoughts to me and she just ended up hurting me and literally wrecking me. I needed like 5 months in order to be slightly functional again.

I was working on a group project my senior year of high school. My partner spent the majority of the time bad mouthing me and saying I did no work. It got so bad I tried to throw the assignment, but sadly I failed. In the end we went finished and nevere talked again.

I had a friend that interfered with a relationship I had with an ex-girlfriend and he got her to cheat on me with him. He lied and said nothing happened, but I found out through texts on her phone that they hooked up and that they were meeting up and hanging out together. This one friend got in the middle of a good relationship I had and I had to cut ties with both my ex and with him.

In April this year I had to reach out to my mother in law about her son who was in jail. The minute I mentioned anything about money and bail, she started yelling. At that point she accused me of stealing his money for my own use and not doing anything to help him out. In reality my husband didn't even make much money at all and he was actually borrowing money from my credit card, the money he made  in my account wasn't much. She didn't apologize for her actions to me and said she was stressed, I didn't believe her. Of course after the ordeal she called me up and tried to blame me that I was trying to coerce her which I never did and I told her I don't tolerate people yelling at me. I still haven't forgiven my mother in law for her behavior since then.

I knew a man in a market in Honduras. He sold groceries to me, and I trusted him. It turned out that he was overcharging me badly for my purchases. I cut off all business relationships with him. When he came back to try to get me as a customer again, I refused and never spoke to him again.

My father decided to start dating a 24 year old woman when he was 65.  I knew it was a bad idea but I didn't say anything.  I drove down to spend a week at the beach with them one summer and after he went to bed she tried to bang me.  I rejected her and went to bed only to be woken up by my father demanding that I leave for trying to seduce his girlfriend.  I told him what really happened and he refused to lsiten to me.  I left and haven't forgiven him for it.
Problems: I feel very sad and alone now.

describe: my former significant other deliberately harmed me emotionally the day my 16 year old dog died. I had asked him to stay home with me that evening and he said he couldn't, he had made plans with his buddy to play pool and have a beer. Then he borrowed my car and cheated on me. He never even apologized. Wow, my dog died and he cheated the same day. Who does that?

I had a "friend" who I was once close with.  After he moved away we our relationship moved further apart.  One day he came to the area and wanted to stop by for a visit.  It turns out he only wanted to stash his car at my place to he could spend the rest of the day with a closer friend in Chicago.  I never forgave him for this.

One time someone harmed me emotionally was my ex boyfriend called me some pretty nasty names and made a public scene. I had broken up with him about three weeks prior when I ran into him somewhere. I had been avoiding his phone calls because he was so angry with me and wanted to give him a lot of space. He saw me out with a friend that happened to be male and lost it on me. I was so worried the cops were going to be called but fortunately they weren't. Though I've never been so embarrassed in my life.
Problems: No, everything was easy to understand.

describe: I was playing around with a family member and we were play hitting and poking each other. The other person then proceeded to hit me with a hair brush, which really offended me and I told them I was not okay with. I was angry and refused to speak to them afterwards because they knew how I felt about being hit with physical objects. That person apologized and I told them that I was very angry about it, but to forget it, because it had already happened. I didn't forgive them for that, and I never will because I am not okay with physical violence and to me, that's what it felt like. It felt like we were no longer playing and it was serious.
Problems: Everything was clear and easy to understand.

describe: One such time was when a former good friend and I had a falling out. It was mostly this friend's fault but i was willing to forgive. However, this friend took advantage of the situation and started spreading false rumors about me. I felt devastated and betrayed. After that, I felt I could never forgive this person again and I never did.

A "friend" tried to hook me up with her friend. Things felt off to me, so I grew distant with them both. It turned out she was the friend the whole time. She went off on me and said mean things, even though she was at fault. I hate that person til this day.

About 8 years ago I was having relationship problems and I went to my parents house for some me time. I ended up arguing with my parents and had a falling out with my dad. He pushed me and I slapped his face. He came running after me and pushed me to where I fell on the ground. I was bleeding from my knees, toes, and fingers. I landed in concrete and almost bust my head on a brick. I saw the brick and almost grabbed it, but I calmed down and walked away. I could never forgive him for what he did.

I was home one evening and heard something outside my house. I went out and I guy was in the back of my truck pulling things out. I had a bat and started beating this guy silly. I called the police after and had him arrested. He sued me in court because I broke many bones and semi crippled him. I might have gone overboard 7 years ago but when you steal from me I needed to defend myself, wife and child. I did not forgive him one bit

I was playing in a softball game, in a summer co-ed league.  Our team lost, and I got into an argument with a younger woman on my team, which she started.  It was just a verbal argument, but at one point she became very upset and punched me in the face, which caused me to have a black eye. Even though it was her fault, many of the other people on the team took her side, because she lied about what happened, and she never apologized to me.
My ex husband cheated on me. I found out he had a whole other family, baby and all. They didn't know about me either, but he chose them. Later, it was made known that the baby wasn't even really his.

I went into business with a friend of mine approximately 10 years ago.  We opened a wholesale business in the Midwest that was somewhat successful.  As time went by, i noticed that the accounting wasn't adding up.  It turns out my friend/business partner was personally taking money out of the business bank account.  Rather than come clean my friend lied and that was the end of our friendship.

One person who harmed me emotionally was my best friend at my previous place of employment. This person was my best friend and we spent countless lunch breaks eating and hanging out together. One day, this person decided to tell a lie to my supervisor so that he could get the promotion opportunity instead of me. I was shocked when my manager told me that I was passed over for the promotion because someone said that I had anger management issues. After noticing that my best friend was promoted instead and hearing rumors that he was spreading this lie around the office, I confronted him. To his credit, he told me the truth and wanted to remain friends. I was hurt emotionally and shocked that someone I thought was close to me would betray and hurt me in such an unexpected way by spreading a lie about me. I told him that our friendship was over. Soon after, I found a new position and left the company. I never forgave him and have never talked to him ever since.

My friend stopped contacting me for no apparent reason.  He shirked his duties on a shared project.  This put my educational career in jeopardy.  I never forgave him for this.  We have not  been in contact since.
Problems: The definition of "event" could be more clear.

describe: A colleague of mind spread vicious rumors about my being racist. They made accusations about me saying racists comments to them and about them to others. It was extremely detrimental because it was at my place of work. I was told by my superiors about what had happened with no chance to defend myself against the lies. I have never forgiven the person for their lying and they have never apologized.

A few years ago, I was car pooling with my cousin and a mutual friend, and it was going well for a year, after that my cousin and our friend started treating me differently and bullying me.  After a year I had enough and I found another job, so I didn't have to commute with them anymore.  My cousin truly hurt me because I feel she chose our friend instead of choosing her cousin.  To this day, I have not talked to her.

Several years ago, a friend and I decided to start a writing project together. The goal was to create a book from this, but a lot of it was just having fun creating characters and writing little vignettes. We both really enjoyed the process, and having never had a writing partner before, it was fun for me to have someone to bounce ideas off of as we were putting together the plot. We both got really into the project, and I was personally very emotionally invested, but one day after several months, my friend approached me out of the blue and told me that our partnership was over and that she wanted to completely divorce me from our book so that she could complete it herself. I had no idea that she had been feeling this way, and felt incredibly hurt and betrayed that I was being cut out of the project. We had been good friends until this point, but we stopped talking or interacting after this point, and eventually drifted apart completely.

My roommate punched me in the face because I was cracking jokes about him dropping out of college. We had a relationship at the time that was mostly about trashing each other in a friendly way. He participated enthusiastically, and so I thought it would be a fine topic to joke about. But instead, he started throwing punches because he was having a bad day.

I had been in an up and down relationship with my ex for going on 8 years. I thought things were on the mend but she thought otherwise and decided to abruptly end things. She completely left me in shambles, disregarded me and trashed my emotional well-being. It took me several weeks to feel any resemblance of normal and I still can't bring myself to forgive her for her actions and behavior. I cried so much that I ran dry and every memory was painful.

I had gone out on a date with someone who I had been talking with through a dating website.  The man, a police officer at that, had gotten me drunk and sexually assaulted me.  I remember him putting his gun badge and gun on my coffee table before he assaulted me and told me that nobody would believe me.  I was petrified--to this day, I never reported the incident to authorities.

This person was a coworker that lied to me. This person was a compulsive liar and I bought into their lies. In the end, going along with their lies and violating my trust destroyed my career at my employer. I have never and will never forgive this person.

I had a friend that decided that they didn't want to be friends anymore. It was related to another friend and distant relationships. They were definitely emotional about our ordeal. They were verbally abusive because of their anger.

In 2014, I was living in another state with my friend, and she had to move back home, leaving me in a lurch. I ended up having to move back in with my parents, and she left me there without any kind of assistance or anything, and I was totally broke. It took me a year of hard work to finally get my own place again. I was very resentful of her for a while, but I ended up getting over it and accepting her friendship again. I forgave her for the harm she caused me, and I feel like we're pretty close friends again now.

When I was 20 years old, my now ex girlfriend was having problems with substance abuse. She kept it hidden from me, but I found out about it and confronted her about it. She told me she wouldn't do it again and that she was quitting. Come to find out, she was still buying the pills from someone and once again, I discovered this. I told her that we would be through if she did it again. I followed through with the ultimatum that I offered her. About two weeks later, she was already seeing someone else, so it was kind of a double whammy. The only reason she started seeing this other person so soon was to hurt me. Flash forward three years and she called me and wanted to talk. During the conversation, I told her I forgave her for what she did despite how badly I was hurt by the whole ordeal.

My best friend called me names when she was upset that I had hung out with someone else, and she did so for a few weeks, just really going in on me. However, after a while she gave up and told me why she had been acting that way, and I totally understood and apologized to her for what she had been going through, and fully forgave her.

this morning me and my husband were having a conversation while he was commuting to work and the conversation got a little heated. he started raising his voice and it really hurt my feelings and triggered some bad memories that stem in my childhood. I started crying and couldn't catch my breath and i could tell that he felt bad about it. He apologized before he went in to work and we ended up making up before he had to get off of the phone.

I got pretty upset at a close friend who was found to shared information that was private about me with someone else. It wasn't terrible information exactly, but I was not on good terms with the person that they shared it with and it was just none of their business. We eventually hashed it out through conversation. I expressed how I felt, and they apologized. It will be hard to really trust them again, but I did forgive them.

I believe I was 30 when this incident occurred. I remember getting into a huge argument with one of my older brothers who betrayed my trust and told my older sister lies that I mistreated my father while he was suffering from dementia. To this day I have no idea why he did what he did, but in the end my older sister didn't believe him and we had a falling out over that. He also included my mother in that horrible lie. He was always nice and kind to me before, so him doing this was like stabbing a knife in my back. I didn't speak to him again until my father was on his deathbed. I decided, against my mother and older sisters wishes, to speak to him again and  forgive him. I wanted him to speak to his father one last time. However, my father died soon after and he never got the chance. While I did forgive him, we never talked again after that, even at the funeral.

A time I was harmed emotionally was when I was planting flowers one very warm summer day in my back yard. My dad, who suffers from mental illness, was at my home. He was painting a portal basketball net that I did not ask him to paint. I was to sell the basketball net that day to someone and this was really inconvenient for him to do. He did this, I am guessing because he is mentally ill. He was on a ladder painting the post part of the basket net when he fell off the ladder and spilled the paint every where and even on the house and driveway. I was very close by and went to him. I said oh my God there is paint everywhere and the buyer is coming very soon. Well my dad exploded and said I don't care about him and he began swearing at me using profane words and told me I should just go in the house. My own house! Where he does not live! Well I became extremely upset to the point I was crying and shaking uncontrollably. The effects of this still linger today. It was very very difficult for me emotionally.

About three years ago, I got into a bad arguement with my father. It wasn't something very serious but it went out of control. He ended up telling me that he hoped I'd die and that he was sick of me. I yelled the same thing back at him, but later on I cried hard and felt bad for years. I didn't see him for a while after that but when I did he apologized and said how sorry he was and I forgave him.

One of my family members was having a trouble at work and was drinking excess amounts of alcohol to cope with his problems. One day when he was very drunk, he said some very inappropriate comments to me that I didn't appreciate at all. He also become physically aggressive. He was drunk and I had no trouble standing up to him, but the fact that he turned on me like that was very troubling. It took a long time for me to forgive him.

I was punched from behind by a guy that thought I said something about him.  There was alcohol involved.  Other people stopped him after a few shots.  I had nothing to do with it.  He semi-apologized later.

My now ex-girlfriend and I were "taking a break" but we were still living together. We were still acting exactly as we were when we weren't on a break, which was hard to see it as such. I found out that she slept with another man in our apartment during that "break". She seemed genuinely sorry and I ended up forgiving her.

My cousin harmed me emotionally when she told me that I needed to lose weight. It was at Christmas and I was eating a lot that day. I guess she thought she was being helpful. She told me I should cut back on my calories because I needed to lose weight in my stomach area. I as mad for awhile but ended up forgiving her a month later.

my boyfriend when i was 18 broke up with me right before high school graduation. I found out that he had wanted to date someone else. I also found out that he cheated on me with this girl while he was still dating me.  It was very difficult for me as we had been dating for 3 years.

I had a crush on one of my best friends for a while. He knew it and he sometimes acted the same way with me, sometimes didn't. One day he told me that when he was talking to someone else that he told them I would perfect if I had a better body. I laughed it off and tried forgetting about it. It still haunts me to this day and has really impacted me emotionally.

When I was younger I would play in the playground with friends at school. We would play hide and go seek and it would get intense. One day I climbed the latter to the place we always were waiting to count. I closed my eyes at the to of the latter facing it so I could quickly get down when I opened my eyes. I started counting and all of a sudden I felt a push and fell 8 feet with my eyes closed landing all of my weight onto my right arm. It broke. It was the worst pain ever. I decided to forgive my friend becuase yes what they did was stupid but I know they didnâ€™t intentionally hurt me.

I have had an estranged relationship with my dad nearly all my life and have not made any attempt to reach out and contact him, nor has he made any attempt to reach out to me. I understand that he simply doesn't care about my wellbeing and I am willing to accept that reality. There isn't much I can possibly do to change his mind on the matter and am willing to move on with my life.

Six years ago I was in a horribly awful relationship. They were an alcoholic and constantly cheating on me. I felt trapped and depressed, I was desperate to feel love and not feel so tortured and alone anymore. I finally found an escape about 1.5 years into the relationship and left. It has been tremendously hard to forgive them for the things that they have done. But I know that not forgiving someone only holds hatred, anger, and sadness within yourself. You have to forgive to be free, so I have.

My boyfriend and I got into a fight in the car on vacation. We had been discussing something important about our future when he blew up at me because I said something that offended him. He spent the next hour calling me horrible names and threatening to drive back which would have wasted the money I spent reserving things.

I emotionally harmed by friend by breaking a promise. We didn't talk for several weeks. However, afterwards we made up and studied for the final together. We are still decent friends but  I question our friendships ometimes.

I had a fight with my mom, and she freaked out beyond the normal level. She was so rude and aggressive and said awful things to me. I resented them for a long time, but eventually I've come to forgive them. I just don't care to keep holding a grudge for all of this time.

My healthcare provider harmed me physically last year when they prescribed a medication in the incorrect dosage. As a result of this error, I ended up consuming a dangerously high amount of the drug in question. The high concentration of the drug in my system caused a number of uncomfortable and distressing physical symptoms, the most extreme of which was a severe outbreak of rash on part of my body. I eventually forgave this healthcare provider, however, because I know the mistake was unintentional and also not the result of poor training or lack of attention.
Problems: Everything was explained very clearly and worked properly. No problems or confusing text encountered at all.

describe: A woman i cleaned house for and took to doctors appointment said something mean to me for no reason, out of the blue. She screamed at me when I was just talking casually about something. It did not make any sense . I left her house soon after that. She called me later that evening and sort of apologized by saying she felt bad earlier. I forgave her and kept working for her after that.

I remember I was once played basketball with my uncle. I was guarding him close cause I wanted to win. When he got the ball he made a move and his elbow went directly into my eye. It instantly swelled up. Of course, I was mad but I forgave him because he is my uncle.

I was hurt by a friend who stopped being friends with me because his girlfriend was jealous of me. We had a brother sister relationship. This lasted a year. It was very hard on me because he flat out ignored me when seeing me at the store and wouldn't answer my texts. Once they brokeup he wanted to be friends again. I believe in giving people second chances.
Problems: Everything was clear. I would have picked a different situation if it had said I didn't forgive the person. Thank you for allowing me to participate.

describe: There was a man who I was in love with but we were both in relationships that were ending. I moved on from my relationship so we could be together, at great personal cost. He kept telling me that I just needed to give him time and he would do the same and we could start our life together. I kept telling him I didn't want to be part of a lie and he kept telling me to hold on and making it sound like I was being the unreasonable one for wanting to stop being in limbo. It all ended up tearing my life apart.

My ex-girlfriend would start fights based on imaginary things that would bother me a lot. Sometimes I would spend all night explaining to her that what she is accusing me of, be it deleting texts, having feelings for strangers, etc. were impossible. One night she hit me in the back of the head before going to sleep which infuriated me but I kept my cool and ignored her. Eventually after a few days, I forgave her and tried to move on.

I had a big argument with my step son one evening. He was so disrespectful to his mother and I could not stand by and watch that happen.  There were several things that he said and once they were said there was no way of taking it back. It took several months but eventually I forgave him for the things he said about me and to me which were extremely hurtful at that time.

I was interested in dating a girl that I had been interested in for a while.  We knew each other from friends and we would chat every once in a while.  We went out a couple times and I thought that we were getting along great.  However, texted me that she was not interested in seeing me anymore.  I felt emotionally hurt by this development.  However, over time I forgave her and just wrote the whole thing off as 2 people who were not compatable with each other.

A friend of mine once told my secret to some other people. It was a really important secret, one I really really did not want people to know about. I could not believe that someone I trusted could do that to me. My friend apologized and over time, we became tight again.

My spouse revealed to me that she had had an affair in the first part of 2018.  This revelation harmed me emotionally as I was blindsided and shocked at this information.  I did a lot of sould searching to determine how to respond.  I decided to forgive my spouse and to see if there was an opportunity to reconcile and repair the damage.  I forgave her after we went through couples counseling.
Problems: I didn't have any problems with any of the material in the study.  Nothing was unclear or confusing.  Thanks for the opportunity to participate and good luck with your research!

describe:
was very close to a person, can't disclose the exact relationship here.

I used to visit their place often, talk to them on phone, it was a nice relationship.

I always knew that the person was a little negative in nature, and by negative, I mean seeking pleasure in other people's miseries and having a prominent feeling of jealousy.

And then, I faced a tough financial phase in life once, a few years ago.

I have a habit of not discussing my miseries with people, but still, information doesn't need a proper source to travel in Indian households.

And then I visited that person one day.

I could notice a change in behaviour the moment I entered their house. All they did was to enquire about my financial position, and mock at me indirectly.

I didn't spend much time with them, and returned soon.

I was angry, sad and disappointed at the same time with that person.

I did not seek revenge, neither did I start hating them, all I did was to subtly break most ties with them, without letting them know.

Today, I meet them at occasions, greet them, smile, talk a little, and that's about it.

A time a person harmed me physically was a time when I got into an argument with a friend. The argument became so heated that my friend pushed me, which caused me to fall and hit my head. I was pretty hurt, and there was even a little blood. My friend was instantly regretful, apologized to me and helped me to my feet. I ended up forgiving them because we have been friends for a long time.
Problems: I did not have any problems, and I did not find anything to be confusing.

describe: A few years ago, someone physically harmed me during an argument. It was another man, and we are arguing about a topic. It was tense and sensitive, and ended up getting physical. He started it, and I did not fight back. I ended up forgiving him shortly thereafter.

Seven years ago I was raped by a guy in my group therapy.  He raped me after driving me home from group.  He slammed me against a desk and shoved himself in me.  He shoved himself in three of my orifices.  I forgave him because I had to see him on a weekly basis, so I really had to.

I have a friend who is an Evangelical.  Normally she won't push her beliefs on me but recently, she had at it...and not in a good way.  She went on a tirade about how she is right about everything and used that perception to drag me down to some pretty low levels.  There doesn't seem to be any "practice what you preach" feelings with her.  There is only winning and losing, not right or wrong.  This is a horribly bad way to live your life.  It put a huge strain on our friendship.
Problems: Everything worked fine.  Best wishes with your study and stay safe out there : )

describe: My friend wasn't there for me when she said she would be. I was having a hard time with my job and everything was coming down on my head. I was having the hardest time of my life and my best friend deserted me when I needed her the most. We ended up coming to terms and I forgave her. We are as close as ever now and I know it wouldn't happen again.

I was living in my one bedroom apartment.  A friend of my sons asked to stay a few days so I allowed her to do that.  When a week had gone by, instead of moving out she moved 3 of her friends into my apartment as well.  They told me that they would pay me for the month that they were staying with me.  I went ahead and got my car repaired thinking that I would have extra money to pay my rent.  When it came time to pay the rent, none of these people staying with me had a dime to give me.  I was $200 short of paying my rent so was evicted from my apartment.  Instead of leaving immediately, these people continued to live in my apartment.  I was really upset and hurt about all of this.  I moved in temporarily with a friend and they eventually moved out.  I had just one more month on my lease and would have been done..
Problems: No problems with this study.  The instructions were clear and easy to understand.

describe: my current fiance and I have been together since high school. some time after graduating from college I got really depressed and started questioning everything including our relationship. I decided that i wanted to take a break and see other people. i tried and out and i ended up deciding it wasn't for me. we ended up getting back together. one day i found out that he was still in communication with someone that he showed interest in while we were not together. i got really upset and didn't understand why they would continue to talk to other people if we were back together. they gave me their reasons for doing what they were doing and i decided to forgive them and move on, even though it made me feel really inadequate and hurt my feelings that they would do that.

My ex-girlfriend decided to get back at me by telling my mother a very private secret I had told her concerning sexual abuse by my grandfather. I was upset emotionally and mentally because this wasn't something my mother was ready to handle about her father. I did forgive her years later, but I will never forget.

When my second child was born, it was expected that I would choose my cousin to be her godparent. However, I knew I couldn't do that because to be a godparent means a lot more than just having that title. It means, that if we are gone, that godparent needs to be able to raise our children in our faith, it means that, as godparents, they need to set examples to our children of our faith and my cousin doesn't live according to our faith. So, I couldn't choose her to be a godparent, unfortunately. My aunt figured this out and was livid and basically called me and my husband bigots and closed minded and other stuff that truly hurt me. It hurt me emotionally because I grew up seeing my aunt and my cousins a lot and they know me, they know I am not a bigot and closed minded, they know my personality so I felt as if she was slapping me in the face, it definitely hurt and caused some tension in the family. However, my husband was able to talk with her for hours and explain our situation regarding godparents and our faith. My Aunt (who is the same faith as us) finally seemed to understand and was able to calm down. I truly forgave her for the way she acted and we still went to Christmas that year. We still continue to have a close relationship with my Aunt.

I was with an ex-girlfriend and we got into an argument. She was aggressive and she punched me two times. She was also yelling at me. This was over something small and when I found out she has a bad temper. I did not hit her at all.

This past new years I went to a party at a friends house. One of my best friends was hammered and getting ready to drive home. I think I was one of the only sober ones there, so I had to stop him. I could't convince him with words, so I wrestled his keys from him and offered to drive him home. It quickly escalated from him shouting at me to punching me. All it took was a shove to tip him over, and I kept him on the floor till he calmed down.

An ex-girlfriend harmed me emotionally by cheating on me with one of my good friends. This hurt me very deeply because I loved her but we had a very toxic and destructive relationship. It also hurt me because it was one of my friends that she cheated on me with which made it a lot worse. It affected me for a long time but I eventually moved on and forgave her for what she did because I hurt her emotionally in the past also. I believe it was karma that came back to bite me in a way.
Problems: No problems and everything was clear.

describe: One time, my mother ended up hitting me with a belt, but this time it hit me in the face. When it hit my face, it hit my eye and caused severe redness to it. She may have not been in the right for doing this, but she is my mother and years down the line, I was able to forgive her for this. I knew it was an accident, and I knew she did not mean to hurt me in that way/

When I was much younger I was harmed by a relative. She was much older than me. She instructed me to do all the household chores. I was very tired and could not finish them all by myself. She was very angry and hit me in my face. I cried and I will always remember that day.

I was vying for a managerial position where I work.  I had the seniority, the knowledge, the leadership qualities that made me a great candidate for the job.  One day during a meeting I was playfully nudging a close co-worker who ignored me.  Surprised, I again  tried to get her attention and was rebuffed.  I felt offended but left her alone.  At the meeting it was announced that that particular coworker got the position.  I did not even know she applied and my work, attendance and knowledge  was far better  hers.  I left her alone for several weels.  Ultimately we came together and talked it out.  I was then able to forgive her.

One of my friend's friends didn't like me.  We were playing football and he kept yelling names at me.  He tried hurting me physically when tackling me, but couldn't.  I just shrugged it off externallly and played it cool but it bothered me on the inside as I did nothing to him.  Later, I just realized he was insecure and I forgave him internally.

One time my friend punched me in the face. I made a terrible joke about his situation because he just decided to drop out of college. He got really upset and punched me. We did not talk for about 3 months, but we made up because we share too much in common and need each other's help. We laugh about it now.

My mother, who has dementia, suddenly grew angry and turned to shout "We always do what you want to do!" It was my first time seeing her in about 30 years, so it took me aback. She then screamed "I don't know you! I want nothing from you!" I had taken her shopping an hour earlier, and we were putting away the things that I bought her, things that she had been so happy to receive because she has nothing. It shocked me because I had been looking for her so long, and I was so grateful to see her.

Years ago, I had an old classmate of mine rob myself and some friends and gunpoint. It happened really quickly, and I was flabbergasted. I didn't see it coming, as we were cool when we were in school. I eventually forgave him though, as he was terribly strung out on drugs. I think he serving a prison sentence these days.
Problems: No, the study went well, everything worked fine.

describe: The incident involved an argument that I had with my spouse. We had been going through a bit of a rough patch, which lead up to this specific event. They eventually told about about some things that they wish had never happened in our relationship,which very much upset me. It made it very hard foe me to be around them at that time, as I couldn't stop thinking about some of the things they said.

So I was dating this girl who I thought was the greatesst person ever, but I found out she had dated my friend in the past and I had no idea. So one day he invites me over to his house and its an ambush, he started attacking me, throwing me around. Telling me that shes too good for me and that i'm a jerk for trying to sleep with another mans girl. I ended up getting a broken finger but I broke his jaw and he fled when I threw a sauce pan at him. It was absolutely awful and I have no idea why they did that to me when they had to have know

My ex husband beat the crap out of me and almost killed me.  I had forgiven him several times and always stayed with him.  The first time it happened was only a month or two after I found out I was pregnant with our daughter.  It didn't happen often, maybe once or twice a year.

I want to say it was about 6 years ago. I was seeing someone at the time and went out of town for a few days for a convention. When I got home she was in the house with another guy and they had clearly been there for a while. Naturally I started yelling and threatening the dude. This resulted in him just leaving and then a huge arguement with my girlfriend at which she berated me quite extensively. She left and went home to her parents house and officially broke up with me the next day. A few years later she called me up and appologized and i decided to just let it be water under the bridge. it was awkward for a while but eventually we went back ot being good friends,

My girlfriend and I broke up fairly early in our relationship, initially. We ended up getting back together after being friends for a few months. We talked about what happened between us, and she apologized, she left when I needed her, but she didn't leave me for anyone. She simply didn't know how to handle me, which is completely fine, and we've worked everything out, and have been together for over a year and a half since.
My uncle who was my caregiver verbally abused me. He told me very bad things

My girlfriend at the time broke up with me , and later i found out it was because she was already talking to someone else. I was really hurt and sad about the whole thing i kept on thinking about what i did wrong. Time passed and we eventually bumped into each other again, and i held no sadness anymore i forgave her. I was hurt but not enough to hold anger in my heart anymore.
I stole something from the public school. My father found out, and hit me quite severely. I was not close to him for several years afterward. Eventually I forgave him.

My boss gave an assignment to me and a co-worker, Ann. Ann tanked her part of the job and snuck behind my back to the boss to blame it on me. My boss reamed me out publicly and humiliated me. At first she didn't believe me, but then she discovered Ann was the liar. She then publically apologized to me and I forgave her.

My moms ex husband. He was a terrible person for the most part. He harmed me emotionally becaused at the time he fueled my moms drug habit. Ended up shooting his son's dog and trying to shoot mine over killing a turkey. And not to mention the couple times I had to take my mom to the hospital because of him. I did end up forgiving him I guess because my mom left him and he is doing better now.

I was originally going to move across the country with my sister. We both saved up and added money to her bank account. About a month before we were slated to start moving, she got a new boyfriend. Long story short, she moved a couple weeks later with this guy she'd known for all of 3 weeks and left my ass here. She took all of the money, of course.

Some friends and myself were riding ATVs.  We had stopped to eat lunch for the day.  One of my friends had been trying to get me to race him most of the day, and decided that perhaps if he did a few doughnuts right in front of me that it would goad me into racing him.  As he came around and the rear of his machine was facing me a rock about the size of a golf ball was thrown by the tires into the side of my leg.  It knocked my legs out from under me and left a very nasty bruise.

My brother and i got into a fight one day. After a few days some of my things were missing including a Sony PSP. I asked my brother if he took them and he denied it. Later my other brother told me that the brother i got into a fight with did in fact steal my things. I didn't talk to him for a month because i was mad, but also really sad that he would steal from me. I eventual forgave him and we talk all the time.
Problems: Everything was clear and easy to understand.

describe: My girlfriend cheated on me four years ago. It destroyed my life at the time. I didn't talk to her for a number of years after. I was crushed, I couldn't believe what she did. I went into depression. But I spoke to her a few months ago and I forgave her. It provided closure for me and I am happier now.

My boyfriend was being shady and disheartening at random times and it was making me really suspicious but he kept calling me a "paranoid bitch" and after a while I started to believe I was. But I came home from work early unannounced to find him banging my best friend on our couch. I was emotionally devistated by catching them and its made me not trust people for a while. Though we broke up and I didn't trust him ever again, I forgave him which is nicer than what he did to me.

About three years ago, there was a person from my job who was interested in personality. She was especially interested in taking the personality of those in the office. Being the dry, introvert I am, I knew how I was. However when the comment came over my introvertedness being the chief reason I couldn't do well in a job like that, it hurt me emotionally. After a few days though, I forgave them because the comment was based in reality.

i went to a bar to have a drink and after take two bottles i gave the bar man money but he said i didn't give him thinking i was drunk and he molested me and ask his bouncer to bounce me out , i felt ashamed and embarrassed  but all i could do was to go home but three days later he saw me in one of the store in the area and started apologizing that he later saw the money and ask me to forgive him and i did

When I was 16, my mother remarried this man. He used to abuse me and my sisters. For a long time, I thought it was my fault until receiving therapy as an adult. I learned to realize he was a victim of his environment as I was, and learned to forgive him over time.

My mother did something to me that made me question trusting her. She made a statement about my kids that she thought was a joke but it wasn't. I began to explore what I was truly made about. Once I finished I allowed myself to view things from all angles. That allowed me to forgive her.

I had a big fight with my best friend about 9  years ago. He harmed me emotionally so much by saying bad things about me. By yelling and shouting at me in front of other friends. I thought that  was the last day I am seeing him in my life. We didn't talk to each other for years. One day we accidently saw each other and talked to ech other and I forgive him for what ever happened.

I was young and had a boyfriend two years older than me. I went over to his house and we were sitting on the couch. He wanted to have sex but we've already gotten in trouble before and I said no. He called me names and other things and just made me feel bad.

My mom used to be really emotionally and physically abusive to me. She once insulted me and tried to get into a fight with me when I went against her wish and took a roadtrip with my friends to San Francisco. However, I later found out that she has Borderline Personality Disorder. As she got older, her symptoms got better, and she becomes the loving mom that I have always wished to have. Therefore, I've forgiven her for what she did to me.

I met a lady in my church. At first, she was very friendly, and she even became a close friend for about a year.  Then I began to notice that several church members became very cold with me. Later, I found out she began spreading rumors about me and told these ladies that I was talking badly about them behind their back. It turned out one of the ladies decided to confront me in front of her. This is when the truth come out. In the end, she left church. I do not know where she is now. I forgave her.

I was involved in a relationship with a girl that called me her soul mate. I wasn't into her as much as she was into me & she also wanted to have kids & I didn't.  That should have clued me in on what was about to happen. One day I called her & she didn't answer. I thought that was weird because she always answers or calls me back right away. I was concerned so I decided to drive to her house to check on her. There was a strange car in her driveway. I knocked on her door & she came out & was forced to explain she was with another guy on a date. They eventually married & had a kid. It hurt my ego at the time but I got over it fairly fast & forgave her.

my boyfriend was seeing someone behind my back. I was very angry when I found the messages between them. We talked about the situation and I texted the girl telling her that it was over and she needed to leave him alone. I mainly forgave him because at this time he was very ill and in the hospital. I still wonder if I did the right thing

My ex best friend told all my personal secrets to other people. I was so upset I just cried. She betrayed me and hurt me emotionally. It took some time to get over the whole thing. I felt like she did this out of spite. But in the end we did patch things up and became friends again over time.

My mother is crazy.  She is 65 years old and probably certifiably insane.The problem is is that she does not know it. She thinks everyone else is crazy. She walked past me today, I was sitting in the kitchen, and she had been at the stove cooking, and said to me under her breath, " you are a pussy! " I was like WTF?? I forgive her, but it hurt me emotionally none the less..

a parent put me in an emotionally unfair situation against another parent. they put me in the middle of their dispute and made me feel like i had to be a mediator. they would disparage the other parent and it was awkward because i did not appreciate being a release valve in this way. i didn't think it was my place to resolve their issues

For a long time my cousin use to jokingly (but she believed it) say I stole her DVD back when I was young. She truly believed this and while I honestly did not. It was such an odd thing to argue about because what she was blaming me happened years before but one day about 6 years ago, we were in the car and we were arguing about something else when she used the whole DVD stealing to attach my character. We were on our way to eat and I yelled at her saying that I didn't steal the DVDs and in that moment I got so frustrated and upset because shew as attacking my character. I said I'm not going to eat with her and turned the car around and went home. She left as well and for about 4 months I didn't call or speak to her. In the end I apologized because I was the one that reacted and she ended up apologizing as well and truly felt bad.

Three years into college, I had a boyfriend that I truly adored. We were just getting closer to each other and started getting really comfortable with each other as well. We started off as close friends, so we were really close. During the summer, I found out he cheated on me. I usually don't let things like that bother me because we were dating for 3 months, but this one hurt. This hurt because we were like best friends, didn't expect him to do that. After a few years, I forgave him because his friendship was what I enjoyed the most.

I was in a relationship with a person who was a recovering alcoholic. We were very close and I thought I was helping him in life. However, he 'cracked' and got drunk one night. He was extremely emotionally abusive, telling me he hated me, I was ugly and stupid, I ruined his life, he couldn't stand the sight of me.  The relationship ended that night. We talked, apologized forgave and made up and he is still a friend of mine, but our close relationship was over after that.
Problems: No, I thought everything was clear and the questions were easy to understand.

describe: My ex and I have a complicated relationship, we're broken up but we still talk to each other all the time. This past summer we were texting and out of the blue, she tells me that she doesn't want me in her life anymore and that was the end of our communication for about a month. It really hurt me because we had just gotten to a point in our relationship where I began to really consider her a friend and we had come to rely on each other for support. Eventually, she called me and over weeks we patched things up, i forgave her and we became friends again

My best friend completely stopped talking to me after more than 30 years of friendship.  It was due to a new love interest in his life that was jealous of our friendship. It was totally unnecessary and really hurt my feelings. I did end up forgiving him for my own mental health but we still have not spoken, I just don't hold it against him anymore.

I was living in a recovery home for booze addiction about nine years ago. One morning I came from town to have another resident named Paul accuse me to the people in charge that I was not in the building last note. An offense like they will lynch you over. So after defending myself it was obvious I wasn't winning. I got tossed from the program. Years later I was over it and it turned out the next program work. Irrespective of that I forgave anyway which is my way onnce I cool off for a week or so

My neighbor accused me of something that I did not do.  She told other neighbors.  I was offended and troubled at first.  But my neighbors did not believe her because she has issues.  I have forgiven her and moved on.
